p: Lan et al. confirmed that berberine has a major hypotensive effect by numerous mechanisms. BBR raises the expression of enzyme eNOS which is associated with synthesis and release of NO followed by vasodilation. This vasodilation is possibly arbitrated by well known vasodilator PGI2 and KATP channels opening as well as Ca 2+ influx blockage. One study reported thatBBReffects endothelial dysfunction by reducing the maturity of endothelial microparticles. Berberine can also inhibit transcription factor NF-kB and VCAM-1expression as well as VSMC proliferation [ 163] (Fig.Â 7).
